sentences.english: Long ago, people who were rich or important rode horses that were very tall.
sentences.chinese: 很久以前，巨富显要们都骑高头大马。

sentences.english: 15-17 American politics, at both the state and the Federal levels, is too much concerned with the protection of large fortunes.
sentences.chinese: 美国各州与联邦的政治对于保护巨富过于关心了。

sentences.english: Huntsman, 50-year-old born in wealthy homes, the father is a businessman.
sentences.chinese: 现年50岁的洪博培出生巨富之家，父亲是生意人。

sentences.english: Uber-rich Mainland Chinese business owners have been flocking to Hong Kong, and it's not just because it's the world's business and trade center.
sentences.chinese: 中国内地的巨富们正在一窝蜂地拥向香港。

sentences.english: The colonel was one of the richest nabobs of his day.
sentences.chinese: 那位上校是当时最富有的巨富之一。

sentences.english: I checked with my mega-rich friends to learn what pain they were expecting.
sentences.chinese: 我查问了我的巨富的朋友们，了解他们等待什么痛苦。

sentences.english: As an adult, Jefferson himself was considered among Virginia's 30 richest.
sentences.chinese: 成年后，杰弗逊就荣升弗吉尼亚前30名的巨富之列。

sentences.english: Her life is a rags-to-riches story.
sentences.chinese: 她的一生是从鹑衣百结到百万巨富的经历。

sentences.english: Yes, the Super-Rich Delusion is that powerful, infecting all America.
sentences.chinese: 是的，“巨富谬思”就是如此有力地毒害着美国。

sentences.english: There is a sharp contrast between the poorest and the richest.
sentences.chinese: 赤贫者和巨富者形成了一个鲜明的对比。

definition: rich and powerful/rich and influential person/big shot
having wealth equivalent to that of an entire nation (idiom)/extremely wealthy
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
